item.title: Native root detection support for Microsoft Defender on Android
item.description: Root detection is a critical security control that identifies whether an Android device has been compromised to gain elevated privileges or unrestricted access to the operating system. When a device is rooted, built-in security boundaries are broken, allowing attackers or malicious applications to bypass security controls, disable protections, and manipulate sensitive system files. This permits the installation of unauthorized applications and increases the likelihood of unauthorized access to corporate data. Such devices can raise the overall risk level for an organization.
